page.title: 14THE SCHOOL
page.content: { { { }At Ulley there was a school for all the local children.The school closed when the numbers of children attending grew smaller and smaller.The school bell still hangs from the roof.The bell was used to call the children to school.The playground is gradually being overgrown by weeds and grass. The building is now used as a community centre for the villagers.Ulley Youth Club meet in the hall regularly. Old-time dances are held for the old folk each week. Sunday School meets in the building every week and after services in the church the congregation meet for coffee.
